title: [BUG] forecasting in sample and out of sample with prediction intervals in ARIMA/AutoARIMA
body:
> **Describe the bug**

There's a small problem with ARIMA/AutoARIMA when forecasting in sample and out of sample with prediction intervals. In the _pmdarima adapter, when `return_pred_int` is False, `_predict_in_sample` returns a pd.Series but when it's True, it returns a tuple (pd.Series, pd.DataFrame) which raises the append error.

> **To Reproduce**

```python
from sktime.forecasting.arima import ARIMA
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

y_train = pd.Series(np.arange(1,21), index=pd.date_range(start='1/1/2021', end='20/1/2021'))

arima_forecaster = ARIMA(order=(1, 1, 1), suppress_warnings=True)
arima_forecaster.fit(y_train)
arima_forecaster.predict(np.array([-18, -14, -10, 5]), return_pred_int=True)
```

> **Expected behavior**

To return predictions with prediction intervals

> **Additional context**

Traceback :
